thread.title: Trump implies Bush deserves some blame for 9/11
thread.title_full: Trump implies Bush deserves some blame for 9/11 - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Trump implies Bush deserves some blame for 9/11
text:
Mark Zaleski/AP Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump took a crack at former President Bush Friday. Donald Trump stuck a shiv into the Republican establishment Friday by suggesting that former President George W. Bush bears some of the blame for the 9/11 attacks.
"When you talk about George Bush, I mean, say what you want, the World Trade Center came down during his time," Trump said on Bloomberg TV.
Bloomberg anchor Stephanie Ruhle appeared stunned by Trump’s remark.
"Hold on, you can't blame George Bush for that," she said.
© Reuters/CORBIS President George W. Bush listens as he is introduced at the Pentagon Jan. 10, 2002, to sign the Defense Department Appropriations Bill. But Trump would not budge.
"He was President, OK?” the GOP front-runner said. “Blame him, or don't blame him, but he was President. The World Trade Center came down during his reign."
Trump’s crack is likely to send shockwaves through the Republican ranks, especially Bush’s brother Jeb, who is also running for President.
STR/Reuters "When you talk about George Bush, I mean, say what you want, the World Trade Center came down during his time," Trump said. But it’s not the first time Trump has dissed Dubya. He has called his presidency a “disaster” several times.
The bipartisan 9/11 Commission, which investigated the Al Qaeda terrorist attacks that killed nearly 3,000 people on Sept. 11, 2001, concluded the administrations of Bush and his predecessor President Clinton both made mistakes that allowed Osama Bin Laden to launch the deadliest terrorist attack on U.S. soil.
But it did not blame any one person for the intelligence failures.
Bush’s former counterterror chief Richard Clarke, however, testified that Bush scaled back their anti-terror efforts in the months before the attacks — and apologized to the families of the 9/11 victims for failing to protect their loved ones.
csiemaszko@nydailynews.com
